lem of the eye in a section of the book appropriately entitled “Organs of ex-
treme perfection and complication.” He realized that if in one generation an
organ of the complexity of the eye suddenly appeared, the event would be
tantamount to a miracle. Somehow, for Darwinian evolution to be believ-
